title: Understanding Irregular Bleeding
subtitle: What it is, why it's done, and what to expect

content.value:
Irregular bleeding refers to any bleeding that occurs outside your normal menstrual cycle. This includes periods that come more or less often than usual, spotting between periods, or bleeding after menopause.

Understanding your cycle and recognizing changes early can help identify potential issues before they become serious.

content.description: Women experience irregular bleeding at some point in their lives.

items.text: Periods that come more or less often than usual

content.value: Irregular vaginal bleeding can be linked to several conditions. In most cases, the cause is not serious, but it's important to get checked.

items.title: Endometriosis
items.description: Tissue similar to uterine lining grows outside uterus

items.title: PCOS
items.description: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome affects hormone levels

items.title: Hormonal imbalances
items.description: Changes in estrogen and progesterone levels

items.title: Pregnancy
items.description: Early pregnancy can cause irregular bleeding

items.title: Excessive exercise
items.description: Intense physical activity can affect cycles

content.value: Early assessment can rule out serious problems and help you get the right care.

content.title: Seek advice if you experience:
content.description: Any of the following symptoms warrant a medical consultation

items.text: Bleeding between periods or after sex
Periods that are much heavier or longer than usual

content.title: Need immediate help?
content.description: Contact your healthcare provider or call your local emergency number if you experience severe bleeding or pain.

sections.cardTitle: What to Track Before Your Appointment

content.value: Bringing a few notes can really help your doctor understand your situation better.

steps: Record dates and length of your periods
Note how heavy the bleeding is (light, normal, or heavy)
Document any pain or other symptoms
Track lifestyle changes (stress, exercise, weight, medications)

items.title: Period Tracker
items.description: Use an app or calendar to log your cycle

items.title: Symptom Diary
items.description: Note any unusual symptoms or patterns

sections.cardTitle: What to Expect at Your Appointment

content.value: These tests help find the cause so you can get the most suitable treatment.

items.title: Pelvic Examination
items.content: A physical examination to check for any abnormalities in your reproductive organs. This is routine and helps identify possible causes of irregular bleeding.

items.title: Ultrasound Scan
items.content: A non-invasive scan that uses sound waves to create internal images. Helps detect fibroids, cysts, or structural issues.

items.title: Blood Tests
items.content: Hormone checks, blood count, and other markers that help determine the cause of irregular bleeding.

items.title: Cervical Smear (if due)
items.content: A screening test to check for abnormal cells on the cervix. Typically part of routine preventive care.

content.value: Treatment depends on the underlying cause of your irregular bleeding. Your doctor will recommend the most appropriate option based on your diagnosis.

items.title: Hormonal Therapy
items.description: Birth control pills or hormonal IUDs to regulate cycles

items.title: Medication
items.description: Tranexamic acid or NSAIDs to reduce heavy bleeding

items.title: Surgical Options
items.description: For fibroids, polyps, or other structural issues

content.title: Personalised Care
content.description: Your treatment plan will be tailored to your specific needs and circumstances.

content.value: Don't ignore irregular bleeding. Early assessment can provide peace of mind and ensure you get the care you need.
